snippet: The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria appeared to be making a push along the Kurdish border to take ground, control oil fields and water and expel minority groups.
abstract: Sunni militants with the Islamic State in Iraq and Syria repel efforts by Kurdish forces to push them back in areas east of Mosul in northern Iraq.

byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and TIM ARANGO
byline.contributor: Alissa J. Rubin reported from Bartella, and Tim Arango from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: The Islamic State in Iraq and Syria appeared to be making a push along the Kurdish border to take ground, control oil fields and water and expel minority groups.

headline.main: Sunni Extremists Repel Kurdish Forces in Iraq
headline.print_headline: Sunni Extremists Repel Kurdish Forces in Iraq

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
